desc.p: This method works like the services/users/user method, but works with multiple users (instead of only one).

req.name: user_uuids
req.p: Pipe-separated list of user IDs. No more than 500 IDs are allowed.

req.name: fields
req.p: Same as in the services/users/user method. Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested with. See services/users/user method for a list available values.

returns.p: A dictionary. User IDs you provide will be mapped to dictionary keys, and each value will be a dictionary of fields you have selected.
Value of null means that the given user haven't been found. (This behavior is different than in the services/users/user method, which responds with an HTTP 400 error in such case.)
